It is characterized by its delicate, translucent appearance and its ability to thrive in moist, shaded environments. The plant forms dense mats of prostrate stems covered with small, leaf-like structures called phyllids. Sarcopodium clemensiae is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, particularly in areas with high humidity and consistent moisture.
